SEARCH
Package com.xebisco.yield.physics

Klasse PhysicsMain

java.lang.Object
com.xebisco.yield.physics.PhysicsMain
public class PhysicsMain extends Object
The PhysicsMain class is a Java class that handles physics simulation using the Box2D engine.

  • Methodendetails

    • rayCast

      public final RayCast rayCast(Entity2D requestingEntity, Vector2D point1, Vector2D point2)
      Raycast from point1 to point2 and return the closest hit.
      Parameter:
      requestingEntity - The entity that is requesting the ray-cast.
      point1 - The starting point of the ray-cast.
      point2 - The end point of the ray.
      Gibt zurück:
      A RayCast object.

      public void process(float dt)

    • getGravity

      public Vector2D getGravity()
      The function returns a Vector2D representing the gravity.
      Gibt zurück:
      A Vector2D object representing the gravity.

    • setGravity

      public void setGravity(Vector2D gravity)
      This function sets the gravity vector for an object.
      Parameter:
      gravity - The "gravity" parameter is a Vector2D object that represents the gravitational force acting on an object in a 2D space. This method sets the value of the "gravity" instance variable to the provided Vector2D object.

    • getB2World

      public org.jbox2d.dynamics.World getB2World()
      The function returns a World object.
      Gibt zurück:
      The method is returning an object of type "World".

    • setB2World

      public void setB2World(org.jbox2d.dynamics.World b2World)
      This function sets the value of a variable named "b2World" to the value passed as a parameter.
      Parameter:
      b2World - b2World is an object of the Box2D physics engine's World class. It represents the simulation world in which physical bodies interact with each other according to the laws of physics.

    • getVelocityIterations

      public int getVelocityIterations()
      This function returns the number of velocity iterations used in a physics simulation.
      Gibt zurück:
      The method is returning the value of the variable `velocityIterations`.

    • setVelocityIterations

      public void setVelocityIterations(int velocityIterations)
      This function sets the number of velocity iterations for a physics simulation in Box2D.
      Parameter:
      velocityIterations - The parameter "velocityIterations" is an integer value that represents the number of iterations the physics engine will perform to calculate the velocity of objects in a simulation. Increasing the number of velocity iterations can improve the accuracy of the simulation, but it can also increase the computational cost.

    • getPositionIterations

      public int getPositionIterations()
      The function returns the value of the variable positionIterations.
      Gibt zurück:
      The method `getPositionIterations()` is returning an integer value, which is the value of the variable `positionIterations`.

    • setPositionIterations

      public void setPositionIterations(int positionIterations)
      This function sets the number of position iterations for a physics simulation in Box2D.
      Parameter:
      positionIterations - positionIterations is an integer parameter that represents the number of iterations the physics engine will perform to calculate the positions of objects in a simulation. Increasing the number of position iterations can improve the accuracy of the simulation, but it can also increase the computational cost.

      public Scene getScene()
